and I was like “Really cool, especially since I am getting paid to work on AD stuff some of the time”

text: It may not be enforceable. Hard to know. I think the the original intent of these rules was to prevent an employee from inventing something on the clock and then open sourcing it. That’s still a vague desire, so the rules are written with catch all’s giving the rights on anything “related” to work. I write Julia at work. Is improving tooling that I then go on to use myself in my job “related”? Hard to know, and hard to justify dealing with the bureaucracy to find out.
